description: It really is as simple as stepping from side to side to the beat!
You’ll be shifting your weight from side to side, but this time, adding some shoulder movements and a lil more attitude.
The key to break it down and focus on isolating each “section” of your body in order to create the rolling wave motion.
Since the locking arm motion is so sharp and pronounced, use the Woah to accent the heaviest bass beats in your favorite songs.
Give the steps a little more variety by adding jumps, turns, hand claps, and finger snaps too!
It combines the super simple concept of walking down steps with bounces and head bobs.
Master this Figure 8 Sway pattern so that anyone you’re dancing with can easily pick up what you’re putting down.
Remember to allow your shoulders to bounce – the bounce is what gives this move its cool, laidback flavor.
Considered a wedding and all-around party staple, it might look complicated at first, but it’s surprisingly easy!
